Pokud je v tom HTML hlavička, tak tam dodat nebo změnit charset. Příklad: <meta charset="UTF-8"> Nebo starší zápis: <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html;charset=utf-8">

content:
saywellaj said
turned off for preparing for maintenance

I am embarrassed to say that some time in the past 6 years, for reasons of capacity, I shifted the IMAP folder from profile to the second drive in my laptop. The second drive was HDD and had critical SMART event so I removed it and increased the primary SSD to 1TB. That is when I saw the issue. Due to the requirement for a slow, expensive spinning disk, I had decided to go with a single drive.

It was only later that I saw the name of the folder. It took a while but thanks to http://kb.mozillazine.org/Moving_your_mail_storage_location_-_Thunderbird I could add the folder back to the profile and change the settings in Account Settings. Sorry for the trouble. Cheers, Al
creator: saywellaj

content: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1445521 Note: the config editor setting is only for new folders created. For existing folders, you need to use the sample instructions to follow.
creator: davidsk

content:
Here is official info: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird The link also explains how to use config editor so that all future folders you create are unthreaded.

On your question: - set one folder to your preferences and highlight it - click the icon on right side of the menu bar of message list pane as shown on web page - click to apply current view to> and highlight 'folder and subfolders and PAUSE - a menu opens to left with account name. highlight that and PAUSE - another menu opens to its left with account name at top. CLICK THERE and a confirmation message will appear to confirm setting all folders in the account.
creator: davidsk

content:
That's brilliant David

It was the menu bar setting. It wasn't showing up on the right.

All sorted now

content:
Still didnt get this, until I worked it out myself by mistake.

For PC users using 115.10.1...

1. right click next to the search bar, somewhere between the hamburger and the search bar 2. 'menu bar' displays in a new drop down with 2 options 3. Click on menu bar, this will show a new menu bar with 'file' 'edit' 'view' etc 4. select the folder you wish to change and click 'view' 5. got to 'unthreaded' 6. messages in that folder will unthread

Not sure how to do this for all folders, but it works one by by using these steps.
creator: craig117

content: You cannot change an IMAP account to a POP account. Assuming that the frontier account works with Yahoo, stead, create a fresh account for POP and then you can delete the unwanted IMAP account.
creator: davidsk

content: For IMAP accounts, nothing is lost. For POP, all is lost unless you had a backup.

content: Sorry, I was focused on 'clean install'. If thunderbird was not running during the backup, all should be there. The layout would have been c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird. If you can recover the thunderbird folder, you have everything. Then, install thunderbird and exit. Next, copy that thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming. That will overlay the default thunderbird folder and you will have everything.
creator: davidsk

content: One reason that happens is because email providers have their own idea of what folders should be name, such as sent-mail vs sent. Some let you delete the non-standard folder, while others do not. Anyway, on your question, the easiest approach I've seen is to use the addon, importexport. With it, you can highlight a folder and export as eml files and then highlight the other folder and import the eml files. That merges them . If needed, there is an addon, remove duplicate messages, to clear out duplicates.
creator: davidsk
